net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp

Class TcpCon

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.StreamCon
      • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.StreamConReader
        • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp.TcpCon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionI, InetCon, StreamConI, MsgParsable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TcpHandshakeCon

    public class TcpCon
extends StreamConReader
implements InetCon
    A connection backed by TCP sockets.
    Since:
    1.0

      • handleRawInput

        protected void handleRawInput(java.lang.String input)
        Description copied from class: StreamCon
        Called when a raw message has been read from the input stream. The method then parses the string into a MarkupMsg object and adds it the message queue. The new message can be read by calling pollNextMsg().
        Overrides:
        handleRawInput in class StreamCon
        Parameters:
        input - string containing the contents of the MarkupMsg. The input argument can be null if the end of stream was reached.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Description copied from interface: StreamConI
        Returns whether the connection has been closed.

        If the connection is closed, the connection should no longer be used. Be aware, this method can return true even though close() was never called.

        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface StreamConI
        Overrides:
        isClosed in class StreamCon
        Returns:
        true if the connection is closed, false otherwise.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Description copied from interface: InetCon
        Indicates if the connection is still alive.
        Specified by:
        isConnected in interface InetCon
        Returns:
        true if the connection is still connected

      • getLocalId

        public long getLocalId()
        Description copied from interface: InetCon
        The local id should be the same for all connections on one machine. This is not required and is left up to the implementation.
        Specified by:
        getLocalId in interface InetCon
        Returns:
        the local id of the connection.

      • watchEvents

        public boolean watchEvents(InetEventListener e)

      • unwatchEvents

        public boolean unwatchEvents(InetEventListener e)
        Description copied from interface: InetCon

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: StreamConI
        Closes the connection, releasing any system resources. Once a connection has been closed, it should no longer be used.
        Specified by:
        close in interface StreamConI
        Overrides:
        close in class StreamCon

      • isBroadcast

        public boolean isBroadcast()
        Description copied from interface: InetCon
        Indicates if this connection is broadcast connection. What the connection does and how it broadcasts is left up to the implementation.
        Specified by:
        isBroadcast in interface InetCon
        Returns:
        true if the connection broadcasts

      • isLoopback

        public boolean isLoopback()
        Description copied from interface: InetCon
        Indicates if this connection is a loop back connection. In a loop back connection sent messages will be redirected to it's received messages.
        Specified by:
        isLoopback in interface InetCon
        Returns:
        true if the connection loops back
